conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows (A, B, C, and D) cast by four objects change when the light source moves to the back left or right.
The direction of the light source determines the direction of the shadows. When the light source moves, the shadows will shift accordingly.
The closer the light source is to the object, the larger and more distorted the shadow will appear. Conversely, the farther the light source, the smaller and sharper the shadow.
The position of each object relative to the light source affects the shadow's orientation and size.
The initial scene shows four objects above the slabs, illuminated by a light source positioned in front of the objects, slightly to the left.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast behind the objects, slightly to the right.

premise: When the light source moves to the back left, the light now comes from behind and to the left.
conclusion: The shadows will shift to the front right of the objects.

premise: The angle between the light source and the horizontal line decreases when the light source moves to the back left.
The shadow of object A (clock) is affected by the light source moving to the back left.
conclusion: The shadow of A will move to the front right and may elongate slightly depending on the light's angle.

premise: The shadow of object B (sphere) is affected by the light source moving to the back left.
conclusion: The shadow of B will move to the front right and remain elliptical.

premise: The shadow of object C (rectangular object) is affected by the light source moving to the back left.
conclusion: The shadow of C will move to the front right and maintain its rectangular shape.

premise: The shadow of object D (box) is affected by the light source moving to the back left.
conclusion: The shadow of D will move to the front right and generally remain rectangular.

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, the light now comes from behind and to the right.
conclusion: The shadows will shift to the front left of the objects.

premise: The angle between the light source and the horizontal line decreases when the light source moves to the back right.
The shadow of object A (clock) is affected by the light source moving to the back right.
conclusion: The shadow of A will move to the front left and may elongate slightly depending on the light's angle.
